page.title: 20PROBLEMS/ ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
page.content: Traffic Problems: All approach roads and the main street are narrow, due to the village having developed before the advent of the car. Many cottages have no garages, so residents park on the road. An influx of visitors makes The Street impassable. Disused allot- ments could become a car park but this might destroy the rural appearance; tennis courts would add to the amenit- ies. It is undesirable to re-route the service bus through the village but a mini-bus would be an asset. Future Plans: The Parish Council will support suitable building applications, study the feasibility of a mini-bus, improve parking and consider more social events and recreational facilities. Authors- R.Browne,H.Charter,M.Ingram S.Hutchings,B.Quinn,A.Newport. Photos- J.Atkins,F.Newport. Bishopsbourne Parish Council- 1984 Village Appraisal
